title: Real-Time Emergency Vehicle Siren Detection with Efficient CNNs on Embedded Hardware
author: Marco Giordano (Dpt. of Information Engineering, University of L'Aquila), Stefano Giacomelli (Dpt. of Information Engineering, University of L'Aquila), Claudia Rinaldi (National Inter-University Consortium for Telecommunications, University of L'Aquila), Fabio Graziosi (Dpt. of Information Engineering, University of L'Aquila), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses sound event detection with a focus on real-time processing on embedded systems, which could be relevant for developing efficient audio processing systems in various applications.
background: The task focuses on detecting emergency vehicle sirens from audio streams in real-time using efficient convolutional neural networks on embedded hardware.
contribution: This paper introduces a full-stack system for real-time detection of emergency vehicle sirens utilizing Efficient/Emergency Pre-trained Audio Neural Networks (E2PANNs) optimized for embedded platforms.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing models often require high computational resources or sacrifice accuracy for real-time capabilities, making them unsuitable for embedded deployment.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon traditional methods by employing an optimized CNN architecture and adaptive frame inference strategies, achieving effective detection on a Raspberry Pi.

key_innovation: Utilizes an adaptive frame-length mechanism and a multithreaded system to balance real-time performance with detection accuracy.
real_world_impact: The implementation demonstrates how low-cost, efficient audio detection systems can support smart city applications for emergency response, potentially enhancing public safety.
limitations: The accuracy dependency on refined dataset quality highlights a potential issue that may limit generalizability to varied real-world environments.

new_terms.E2PANNs: **Efficient/Emergency Pre-trained Audio Neural Networks** are a specialized type of convolutional neural network designed for audio event detection, emphasizing efficiency on embedded systems.
new_terms.WebSocket: **WebSocket** is a protocol providing full-duplex communication channels over a single TCP connection, suitable for real-time applications.
